greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Pi^2/12.
reference: C. C. Clawson, The Beauty and Magic of Numbers. New York: Plenum Press (1996): 98
Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge University Press, 2003, Section 2.11 p. 126 and section 8.5 p. 501.
Jolley, Summation of Series, Dover (1961) eq. (234) page 44.
link: Ivan Panchenko, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards, Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972 [alternative scanned copy].
Michael Penn, A viewer suggested integral, YouTube video, 2021.
formula: Equals zeta(1,1), the double zeta-function with both arguments equal to 1. - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 10 2011
Equals Integral_{x=0..1} log((1+x^3)/(1-x^3))/x dx. - _Bruno Berselli_, May 13 2013
Equals lim_{n->infinity} A244583(n)/prime(n)^2. See A244583 for details. - _Richard R. Forberg_, Jan 04 2015
Equals Sum_{k>=1} H(k)/(k*2^k), where H(k) = A001008(k)/A002805(k) is the k-th harmonic number. - _Amiram Eldar_, Aug 20 2020
Equals Integral_{0..infinity} x/(exp(x) + 1) dx. See Abramowitz-Stegun, 23.2.8, for s=2, p. 801. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Sep 16 2020
program: print([int(c) for c in list(str(zeta(2)/2))[2:-1]]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jul 08 2017
xref: Cf. A072692 (Pi^2/12 is in asymptotic formula related to sigma(n), A000203).
results.author: _Rick L. Shepherd_, Jul 02 2002
